required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Quality of Vision in Implantable Collamer Lens (ICL)
clinical_study.official_title: Pupil Influence on the Quality of Vision in Implantable Collamer Lens (ICL)

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to observe the influence of pupil size upon visual outcome in patients with Visian Implantable Collamer Lens(ICL) and toric-ICL implantation.

detailed_description.textblock: The aim of this study is to observe the influence of pupil size upon the quality of vision outcome in patients with Visian Implantable Collamer Lens(ICL) and toric-ICL implantation. Pre-operation and 3-month post-operation pupil size, visual acuity, quality of vision will be evaluated in patient that had ICL surgery.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (before surgery) and 3 month after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Change in QoV questionnaire score after ICL surgery at 3-month testing will be compare with baseline measurements

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (before surgery) and 3 month after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Change in Pupil diameter after ICL surgery at 3-month testing will be compare with baseline measurements
Change in Wave front aberrometry after ICL surgery at 3-month testing will be compare with baseline measurements
Change in Point Spread Function (PSF) after ICL surgery at 3-month testing will be compare with baseline measurements
Change in Pupil diameter after ICL surgery at 3-month testing will be compare with baseline measurements
Change in Modulation transfer function after ICL surgery at 3-month testing will be compare with baseline measurements

study_pop.textblock: Randomly choosen patients from the hospital records who had ICL surgery at He Eye Hospital, Shenyang, China during September 2019 to September 2020. They must have signed informed consent for their records to be used for education and research purposes before undergoing ICL surgery for myopic correction.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Myopic eyes
- Preoperative corneal endothelial cell count â‰¥2200/mm2
- Preoperative central anterior chamber depth> 2.80mm
- Intraocular pressure within the normal range (10-21mmHg)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe dry eye
- Cataract and glaucoma
- Patients with uveitis
- Retinal detachment
- Patients with autoimmune diseases
- Patients with systemic diseases such as diabetes and hypertension
- Patients with mental or cognitive abnormalities
